title: Ted Cruz Bristles At CNN Anchor's Obamacare Questions

comments.text: the stink of pure evil surrounds ted cruz.﻿
comments.author: vengencefrom1979

comments.text:
I've never seen anyone shut up Cruz, didn't think it was 
possible....wow....Good Job Cris! Love how Cruz eluded the question...lol﻿
comments.author: david jones

comments.text:
What a retard...he's just repeating himself in different ways...and none of 
it explains anything.﻿
comments.author: Mike Stavenes

comments.text: ted cruz solo sex tape …. big fail … no money shot﻿
comments.author: Zaq Voir

comments.text:
Republican presidential debates?? are going to be the biggest shown on 
hearth!!!!!! coming up!!!!! Cruz? Bush? the fat man from New Jersey?? 
wow....﻿
comments.author: R.B. R.

comments.text:
What a spectacle. Cruz who enjoys full heavily subsidized senatorial 
healthcare coverage ranting away to take away that same privilege extended 
by the ACA to regular americans at an affordable cost. He is quite content 
to have the streets filled with the halt, the broken and the uninsured, a 
bit like "The Walking Death", only less fictional and with more guns. It is 
the height of shameful and shameless hypocrisy. Even then Cruz asserts "the 
people to whom I believe I am accountable are the men and women in Texas”. 
Yeah sure! What crass politics!!! His state is ranked first for the number 
of people with no healthcare coverage at all ... fully a third of its 
population ... a condition which he has deliberately precipitated by 
refusing provisions of the ACA.﻿
comments.author: John Townsend

comments.text:
What outrageous lies!!! Cruz keeps asserting that no body wants Obamacare? 
That's a bold-faced cynical lie. The polls show a 40%-50% split of pro vs 
anti ACA. But half of that anti 50% say that despite having some doubts 
they want to see it implemented anyway (ie not defunded). Cruz is 
deliberately advancing a position to defund ACA that only 25% support. 
That's hardly "noboby wants it".

Other outrageous Cruz lies:

> insurance will be more costly. Not so. Premiums are much lower making it 
affordable to millions who could not afford it before. Already because of 
the ACA, premium rebates (amounting to billions) for obscene portions of 
premium dollars that were scalped off for sales, marketing, and lobbying 
Congress, have been returned to insurance holders by the industry.
> quality of healthcare will deteriorate. The quality of US healthcare is 
already ranked 38th in the world and 50 million go without.
> other universal healthcare systems are failing. Not so at all. All people 
are covered and per capita healthcare costs are half US rates, and service 
quality is deemed much higher than the US.

This kind of deliberate mis-information skulduggery is evil, and dangerous.﻿
comments.author: John Townsend

comments.text:
BEAUTIFUL!!   Cruz's automated narrative fails like a frozen computer at 
3:35 when Chris Cuomo asks him, "what are you going to do about it?" and 
Ted The Brain Dead says, "a...a .a...and I sh...share that concern, and 
have been working everyday to highlight the millions of people who've lost 
their "JOBS" because of Obama Care.  This stupid RePIGlican Robot is so 
automated and brainless, so pre-programmed and ideological, he got his 
anti-ObamaCare spew mixed in with his Republican Super Economy spew. 
 F***ing moron.﻿
comments.author: Mark Marsh

comments.text: That's what Republicans do, they wqhine bu they have no solutions.﻿

comments.text:

Just say NO to Repubs

comments.text: Hey Cruz, go back to Canada.﻿
comments.author: Donald Hutchinson

comments.text: OMG he's so creepy!﻿
comments.author: bermudaguy1

comments.text:
The problem with our health care system is that insurance companies, 
doctors, hospitals, drug companies, medical equipment companies, etc all 
want a big piece of the pie.  The US spends 2 times as much per person on 
medical care as the other industrialized countries and we have below 
average overall results especially for infant mortality and children's 
health.  One third of our money goes to billing and administrative costs of 
health insurance.  We need a single payer system that isn't based upon 
being paid fees per procedure to reduce billing costs and reduce 
unnecessary procedures.﻿
comments.author: mentalphysicalism

comments.text: If you want stop being afraid of Obamacare, stop watching Fox.﻿

+Richard Wallace You are one ignorant shit. Just because some doctors and 
businesses are "afraid" some changes "may" adversely affect them because 
they have been watching Fox News you shit in your pants.
Stop watching Fox News if you can't figure anything out for yourself.
comments.author: mentalphysicalism

comments.text:
+mentalphysicalism Wrong, dude, then why don't they openly rave about? Dr. 
Ben Carson detests it. Congress got an exemption and the unions, so they 
weren't bitching about not getting it. So, your ass is making ignorant 
posts--stupid ones. No business wants it. Read before you bleat ignorance.

comments.text:
+Richard Wallace Most doctors don't hate Obamacare so stop making ignorant 
posts. We need socialized medicine so doctors can spend their time treating 
their patients instead of half of their time running a business.
comments.author: mentalphysicalism

comments.text:
+mentalphysicalism Why do most doctors hate Obamacare and many are retiring 
before it hits them? Think before you make a fool of yourself.
comments.author: Richard Wallace

comments.text:
Ted Cruz is just another puppet, implementing laws to fuck the people over. 
SMH﻿
comments.author: ivan medina

comments.text:
But Cruz is correct....the rates ARE going up. A couple I know (with no 
kids) had their premiums go from 180 every two weeks to 472 per month. And 
it went up again even before the year mark of signing up. Only Obama homers 
are supporting ObamaCare.﻿
comments.author: Nick Barnett

comments.text:
+Nick Barnett And once again, you say something is so... therefore 
"Checkmate". What are you actually claiming he said, or promised? Then give 
a reference... when/where did he say what that is on video? The only gotcha 
you have is that he said you could keep your plan if you wanted, not 
anticipating the plans that insurance companies would drop because they 
were ripoffs even though they were "cheaper", not anticipating every 
ridiculous assault on the plan by the Republicans. 

Once you are done proving how Obama has destroyed America, give us some 
information on what the Republican party is going to actually do that will 
make things better than the highest stock market in history, the return to 
low unemployment, expansion of civil rights and health care coverage for 
everyone, not just those that 'choose' to have health care by being rich 
enough to afford it, or deciding not to eat or have housing... and those 
that didn't make the stupid "choice" of having a pre-existing condition... 
like being a woman.
comments.author: scottwa

comments.text:
+scottwa Obama is on video saying those things. Its YOU that's uninformed. 
Check mate
comments.author: Nick Barnett

comments.text:
+Nick Barnett Math is math, even if you pull your unsubstantiated "Facts" 
out of your ass. You are so right, you don't have to provide me with 
anything, and probably better off as I'm sure you'd find you would prove 
yourself wrong if you ever actually referenced anything besides one of your 
fake news sources that are so trusted...

Nice job making up fake Obama quotes as well. Good thing you aren't 
providing anything except propaganda, facts have a liberal bias?


The "fact" that some unnamed unsourced unverified couple had their premiums 
go up doesn't make your statement true or correct. Just means you posted 
something no one can verify and we are supposed to take you at your word 
when you include statements that are blatantly false and twisted.
comments.author: scottwa

comments.text:
+scottwa I dont have to provide you with anything. What I said is a fact. 
Obama said every family would see a decrease in premiums of $2500 per year. 
Instead, it's gone up $2500 on average. The couple I mentioned (with NO 
kids) pay $472 per month. A young couple with no significant medical 
history. Over $100 per month increase ($1200 per year). So my statement is 
true and correct. Math is math, no matter how you want to divy it up.

And Obamacare has ENRICHED the insurance companies. Know why? Because it 
subsidizes those who cant afford it (with my tax dollars, which will 
continue to go up the more people are forced to enroll. 


The REAL reason medical care is so expensive? Because medical SCHOOL is so 
expensive. Why? Because Liberal college professors demand $200,000 salaries 
for teaching 2 classes (like Elizabeth Warren). 


So base your opinions on fact, not made up shit like what's in this video.
comments.author: Nick Barnett

comments.text:
+Nick Barnett said,"But Cruz is correct....the rates ARE going up. A couple 
I know (with no kids) had their premiums go from 180 every two weeks to 472 
per month."

Beautiful job there swapping out units of measurement inside of a single 
sentence... 180 every two weeks to 472 per month!!! My gawd, that's a bit 
over doubled... hey wait... shouldn't it be weeks to weeks or months to 
months? Almost like you are intentionally trying to inflate the numbers. 
Medical insurance /costs has been going up at about 20% a year for decades, 
suddenly an increase is the fault of the system? A system that legislated 
that 80% of premiums MUST be used for care, and a bunch of people ended up 
getting refunds from insurance companies the first year because they were 
taking a larger chunk for profits.

Yeah, some people's rates have gone up. Give more information than, "A 
couple I know". What was their previous plan, what were the deductibles, 
what were the out of pocket costs, what were the caps, what wasn't covered 
due to pre-existing conditions (like being female)? A lot of plans which 
didn't really give any coverage at all, cost a lot less. One woman who was 
bitching about losing her plan that cost $59 a month (I'm doing this from 
memory, so numbers could be off). When someone found out what plan she 
couldn't keep... it was because it was $59 a month, have a huge deductible 
and a LIFETIME payout of .... wait for it.... $59. You would have to have 
survived a nuclear blast in Atlantis while snowshoeing in order to have 
gotten anything out of them.. but the cap on the policy was less than a 
month's payment.
comments.author: scottwa

comments.text:

comments.author: Christian Freud

comments.text:
Now he's getting Obamacare through his job in the Senate on his own 
volition when he has the option of getting much more costly private 
insurance and still can look at people in the eye and not admitting that's 
hypocrisy. This guy is so delusional that he cannot see the hypocrisy in 
this. The same delusion makes him think the majority of Americans will vote 
for him to be the President. If per slim chance that he gets nominated by 
the Republican party to run against the Democrats', he will lose by a huge 
landslide because no matter what you can say about the gullibility of the 
average American voter, the majority of them can see through this guy's BS. 
In a well-informed and well-intended society, the majority will always make 
the best decision. People are in general genuinely good. In a society where 
evil and corruption is the norm, that society does not last long. Life 
always self corrects to maintain the balance.

I have yet heard any news outlet asking him why he chose Obamacare over 
another insurance program that does not participate in the Federal 
exchanges that is Obamacare. Obamacare insurance premium is cheaper because 
it injects competition into the health insurance selling business. 
Competition in business is always a good thing. It drives down cost and at 
the same time provides better services and goods. It's the very essence of 
capitalism. Another fact that mysteriously ignored by the news outlets.﻿
comments.author: Jason Luong

comments.text: +Jason Luong Total ignorance.
comments.author: Richard Wallace

comments.text:
+Spacecoastz What did calling Jason a jerk accomplish? Did it make you feel 
better? Superior?


I disagree with his statement, "In a well-informed and well-intended 
society, the majority will always make the best decision". Not because we 
elected Obama twice, but because I don't believe we are in a well-informed 
society, much less one that is well-intended. I believe we live in a 
society where those who are not well-informed are being intentionally kept 
that way by those who are not well-intended. 


What markets in the US do you think are open? Everything has regulations, 
making some national standards for health insurance like requiring that 80% 
of premiums must actually go to treatment or that you can't just declare 
"pre-existing condition!" and not cover someone doesn't destroy the open 
market, although it makes ripping consumers off just a wee bit tougher. 


Most states have requirements that you have liability insurance to drive a 
car on our commie roads... destroying the open market! Mandate! They want 
you to have a driver's license which comes with the requirement to pass a 
test proving you have some minimum ability to see and drive! Those anti 
open market commies!
Oh wait... that might actually prove your point in reverse. There we have a 
law that mandates that poor people carry insurance that covers rich 
people's losses if they hit their cars. Shouldn't it be on the shoulders of 
everyone that if they want their losses covered in a car accident that they 
should carry insurance that covers only their own losses? If you get hit by 
a drunk driver and your ride is destroyed and you are hospitalized... your 
fault if you made the choice not to be insured. But the law is that I have 
to carry proof of insurance that covers the other parties... not even 
myself. Socialism!
comments.author: scottwa

comments.text:
+Jason Luong Hey Jason, how about taking back your bunch of lies about Cruz 
and his health insurance. Jerk.

"In a well-informed and well-intended society, the majority will always 
make the best decision"...yea, right...we proved that wrong by electing 
Obama twice. Most not informed and self-serving.

"Obamacare insurance premium is cheaper because it injects competition into 
the health insurance selling business"...wrong again....Obamacare is govt 
controlled insurance, running counter to an open market system. In fact, 
Obamacare destroyed true open-market insurance and replaced it with a 
one-size fits none system. Man, are you misinformed!!!

comments.author: Daniel Ortman (Uncle88Dan)

comments.text:
+Eric Pollinger
In broad strokes like that, Obama Care may seem like a good idea. But the 
way it goes about things has significantly deepened per-existing problems 
in this nations health care system. But fixing that requires a subtle 
touch, and if there is one thing Cruz is not it is subtle.
comments.author: Daniel Ortman (Uncle88Dan)

comments.text:
+Daniel Ortman The bottom line is that Obamacare puts more families into 
the system, reduces trips to the Emergency Room for conditions which don't 
require it, and provides a path where people with pre-existing conditions 
can still pay for coverage. It is unquestionably a better system that what 
it replaced but it has its shortcomings - most of which (like our 
dependence on insurance companies) were forced on it by Republicans.
comments.author: Eric Pollinger

comments.text:
+stealthballer
Also, I feel that a more targeted approach will help even more uninsured. 
Small businesses should be able to offer health care. There also needs to 
be a better system for the poor. Because over spending on government 
programs, filling up ERs, and not getting quality care to the poor isn't 
working.
comments.author: Daniel Ortman (Uncle88Dan)

comments.text:
There were so many screw ups getting this law passed, it is hard to say who 
screwed up the most. In the end, I think all parties involved screwed 
something up, which is why I think we need to go back to the drawing board 
so that people who need help can get it.
comments.author: Daniel Ortman (Uncle88Dan)

comments.text:
It was the compromise that caused the issue, the original plan was pretty 
damn nice, but it was Obamacare so naturally the other side couldn't let 
him get his way.

It ended up screwing us.

The problem is it ended up being catered to the insurance industry, which 
will never be a good thing for the people.
comments.author: stealthballer

comments.text:
I wish health care reform had taken the form of helping specific groups of 
people who need it. Sadly however, the ACA had a ripple effect through the 
entire health care industry that wound up hurting most people who already 
had health care.
comments.author: Daniel Ortman (Uncle88Dan)

comments.text:
I had no insurance because my pre-existing condition made it okay for a 
company to tell me to die.

I wasn't hired for two jobs because the cost of insuring me was prohibitive.

I don't think "most" have the negative experience you think they did.
comments.author: stealthballer

comments.text:
You mean besides the average person paying more for health care, the 
average policy covering fewer treatment options, and an increased wait for 
claims to be filed? For a few people, they can now afford health care, 
which is great, but for most, those 3 things have increased to some degree. 
For an extra sick person like me, it is a bigger deal, so I have extra 
reason to hate the ACA.
comments.author: Daniel Ortman (Uncle88Dan)

comments.text:
I have looked at it objectively and can't for the life of me figure out how 
anyone could say it's worse than it was before.

Singular cases aside, how is it worse as a whole?
comments.author: stealthballer

comments.text:
Um, that Obama Care is bad? I can get varying opinions as to how bad, but 
if you mean I should prove that it is not good, I don't need to prove it. 
Any remotely objective look at either the ACA itself, or how it has 
affected the existing health care industry will prove it.

comments.text:
Reality, facts, and track records mean nothing to liberals. It isn't about 
quality, it's all about control. It's perfectly fair if everyone is equally 
suffering to them. What they find unfair is that there are a few who have 
the means to seek better healthcare. HOW DARE THEY!? Instead of propping up 
the poor they bring the rich down to the level of poverty and say they did 
social justice. Liberals are a plague to human society, they've failed in 
the past and will continue to fail.
